page.title: 08Bishop's Wood Sub-station.
page.content: {Bishops wood sub-station}is an outstanding example of the care that is taken in the siting of large electrical installations to insure as far as possible that they blend with their surroundings.The sub-station was sited in the middle of the wood,in a natural "bowl"in the terrian with natural and man-made landscape features forming an effective screen around it.The trees mask the harsh outline of the switchgear from view. Covering an area of about 2.5 hectares (6 acres),the sub-station was built at a cost of about Â£2 million(at 1970 values).Underground cable prevents a "wirescape"effect.The C.E.G.Bs' principal statutory duty is to provide an efficient and economical supply of electricity.Every care has been taken to lessen the inevitable visual impact on the natural environment.(M.Dickson)
